timeline.message:
Avoid unnecessary empty replication operations

When there is no data to replicate, some services are still
creating empty replication operations. This causes redundant migration steps.

PartitionStateOperation should not be sent to unknown members

PartitionStateOperation is sent by master to other cluster members.
Target member might be removed from cluster while invocation is being
retried. In this case, invocation should fail.

Migration operations should rely master member observed by PartitionService

Normally observation of master member and partition update operations are ordered
using the latest observed master by the PartitionService under partition lock.
This was introduced by fa9616336f7c693fa740cf8d60aefebaeb5f19d4.

But there were some remaining direct usages of `ClusterService.masterAddress`,
which are causing inconsistencies while mastership claim is in progress
(while master is about to change).

Introduced a new method, `isMemberMaster(address)`, which returns `true`
only and only if the given `address` is equal to the master address
in ClusterService and the master member observed by PartitionService.

Fix race between fetching the most recent partition table and ongoing migration

`FetchMostRecentPartitionTableTask` is executed when a member becomes master
and used to determine the most recent partition table in cluster.

`FetchPartitionStateOperation` is submitted to cluster members by the new master
to fetch their partition tables.

But if there is a concurrently running `MigrationOperation` while
`FetchMostRecentPartitionTableTask` or `FetchPartitionStateOperation` is being executed,
they might not observe the active migration on local node.
This is a very small window of race but when happens that active migration remains uncommitted
and further migrations cannot be processed on that node.

To fix that, a task submitted to each partition thread to ensure
there's no ongoing migration operation before reading the most recent
partition table on that node.

Only first migration fragment should set active migration in MigrationOperation

First migration fragment should set the active migration
and later fragments should check whether active migration is set
and equal to the expected migration.

Avoid unnecessary empty replication operations

When there is no data to replicate, some services are still
creating empty replication operations. This causes redundant migration steps.
